channel.title: Searching for a String in a file?
channel.description: How do you do it? I have googled it but have not found anything that might be helpful.

item.title: Searching for a String in a file?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

File file = new File("nameoffilehere");
FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(file);
byte[] bytes = new byte[(int) file.length()];
fis.read(bytes);
fis.close();
String fileContents = new String(bytes);
if(fileContents.contains("your string"))
     System.out.println("found");
else
     System.out.println("not found");

Read full topic
item.source: Searching for a String in a file?

item.title: Searching for a String in a file?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

Thtas a command … I already know about it in batch.
You could also do

if exist "STRING HERE" > "FILE DIRECTORY AND NAME HERE" (goto :success) else (goto :error)

Thanks Pwnd, lawl, and deadly.
<3 you guys.
IM NOT GAYY

item.title: Searching for a String in a file?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

start > run > cmd > find /N “STRING HERE WITH QUOTES” FILE_NAME_HERE

i know that its not java related but it works :\

@Pwnd wrote:

IntputStream.readFully(byte[])

Umm, if you just need to know the string is there, String.contains() would be good,
indexOf would be good for location, myb; regex too.

item.title: Searching for a String in a file?
item.dc:creator: @deadly72 deadly72
item.description:
@deadly72 wrote:

BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(“yourtextfile.txt”));
String wtv = “what you wanna search”;
String line = br.readLine();
while ( line != null){
if (wtv.equals(line)){ <-- this only works if the string matches the line other wise use substring
do whatever here…
}
}
